Tasks.Task: Create ExpressRoute Direct using Azure CLI
Tasks.Task Description: Use the Azure CLI to create an ExpressRoute Direct circuit. This involves specifying the ExpressRoute port, SKU family, SKU tier, bandwidth, and location.

Tasks.Task: Create ExpressRoute Direct using Azure Portal
Tasks.Task Description: Navigate to the Azure portal, search for ExpressRoute Direct, and follow the steps to create a new ExpressRoute Direct resource by completing the fields on the Basics and Configuration pages.
Generate the LOA for the ExpressRoute Direct resource by providing the resource name, resource group name, and customer name. Optionally, specify a file location to store the document.
Enable or disable the admin state for primary and secondary links of the ExpressRoute Direct resource using the Azure CLI.
Monitor the provisioned and utilized bandwidth for the ExpressRoute Direct circuits to ensure they meet the required performance and capacity.
Follow the workflow diagram to set up ExpressRoute Direct, ensuring all steps are completed for a successful configuration.
Ensure all prerequisites are met and follow the checklist for a successful ExpressRoute implementation, including reviewing routing, NAT, and QoS requirements.

Tasks.Task: Evaluate project plan for ExpressRoute Direct
Tasks.Task Description: Evaluate the project plan to identify any steps that could lead to blockers or impact the project timeline. Make necessary adjustments to ensure a smooth implementation.
Evaluate regulatory requirements, user authorization, authentication, and network security needs for the ExpressRoute Direct implementation.
Set up routing for the ExpressRoute Direct connection, ensuring proper configuration for data flow between on-premises and Azure.

Tasks.Task: Link a VNet to an ExpressRoute circuit
Tasks.Task Description: Establish a connection between a virtual network (VNet) and the ExpressRoute circuit to enable communication between Azure resources and on-premises infrastructure.
